definition: to leave a message/to leave some empty space in a work of art/to leave idle moments (in one's life, a theater play etc)
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: This book’s dark aspects pool around its margins.
sentences.chinese: 本书黑暗的一面充斥在页边留白处。

sentences.english: The following are some incredibly beautiful examples of using negative space in photography.
sentences.chinese: 以下是在相片中运用留白的一些极致漂亮的例子。

sentences.english: This book's dark aspects pool around its margins.
sentences.chinese: 本书黑暗的一面充斥在页边留白处。

sentences.english: Maybe we could leave this wall white and paint the other wall red.
sentences.chinese: 也许我们可以把这面墙留白，把另一面墙刷成红色。

sentences.english: Such a large expanse of negative space gives the impression of openness or solitude.
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的留白也给人以空旷或寂寞的印象。
